snippet: As the taxi fare increase begins in New York City, not all cab meters have been readjusted to charge the higher rates.
abstract: Taxi fare increase begins in New York City, but not all cab meters have been readjusted to charge the higher rates; the Taxi and Limousine Commission says that about 75 to 90 percent of taxis are charging the new fare, and the rest must update their meters by their vehicle's first scheduled inspection after Sept 30; lag means that riders have several weeks during which their fare may well depend on luck.

byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: As the taxi fare increase begins in New York City, not all cab meters have been readjusted to charge the higher rates.

headline.seo: As Cab Fare Increase Begins in New York, Not all Meters Have Been Readjusted
headline.main: New Cab Fare Calculus: New Decal + New Meter
headline.print_headline: Cab Fare Calculus: New Decal + New Meter
